name: Hilton Garden Inn Cupertino

reviews.text: I stayed here end of November 06 for 6 nights on a business trip, third time in this hotel. The reception staff was very friendly even when arriving late on a Saturday evening.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, friendly staff!

reviews.text: My room was absolutly clean, comfortable and well furnished, equipped with microwave, coffee maker and a large refrigerator.
reviews.title: Great Location!
Great place for short or long trips.
reviews.text: The breakfast (buffet or a la carte, $12.95) is quite above average, and the staff is very friendly.

reviews.title: Great Alternative; Better rooms
reviews.text: regarding the bedding I agree to another reviewer that Hilton does a better job here, but this is nothing one has to worry about.

The hotel is close to I280 so it might be a bit noisy, but should be no problem if the windows are closed. There are a lot of shops and restaurants nearby (i.e on Stevens Creek Blvd), and the Vallco Fashion Park is just across I280 (under renovation right now, should be back into full service somewhen in 2007).
reviews.title: Good Hotel, with asian food across the street
Great Hotel
reviews.text: This is one of the most cozy and well run hotels we were at. Came in mid of the night with two tired children and were welcomed and treated promptly with a personal touch.
I must admit I don't write many reviews, primarily out of laziness. Once in a while, however, a hotel comes along and is so impressive it would be a disservice to other travelers not to comment.
reviews.title: The Best HGI on the west coast

reviews.text: First, the hotel exterior is atypical of HGI; it has the soothing, warm, Californian tile roof and stucco (faux?) look. The lobby area is standard HGI. They offer complimentary airport transportation to SJC, a rarity among Cupertino hotels (it is 10 miles from the airport.) The driver was unavailable when I arrived so they sprung for a $28 cab ride!
reviews.title: Weekend favourite

reviews.text: On arrival, the clerk (Adrian) was very cordial and upgraded me to a one bedroom suite, which was amazingly large, with 20-ft ceilings, for my inconvenience at the airport, and maybe partly for my Diamond status.
reviews.title: Great hotel, but under renovation

reviews.text: Perhaps the most amazing part of the stay was the breakfast buffet, which was complimentary for Diamond members. You select your cooked-to-order omelette as part of your buffet, but the server will bring it to you hot (as opposed to you standing in a line waiting) from the kitchen while you accessorize your entree from the self-serve fruit, potatoes, and meat platters. They also have this Japanese breakfast consisting of grilled salmon, miso soup, scrambled eggs, and steamed rice, served in a little bento box--delicious. Can't say I've seen that offered at any other HGI. I must not forget Rose, our incredible server who has been at this location since it opened. I'm sure her legendary reputation (see previous reviews) needs no additional accolades--lets hope management can prevent her from retiring (read--more money).
reviews.title: Pretty good hotel, too expensive

reviews.text: In summary, great room, great food, great staff, great weekend rates, and great location. What more can you ask for?
reviews.title: Nice hotel, a bit noisy

aka: Hilton Garden Inn Cupertino Hotel Cupertino
